Class Encounter

  • java.lang.Object
    • Encounter
  • public class Encounter
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that initializes encounters.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Encounter​(int numMon, int numP)
      This will build an encounter which will have an array of Monsters, Players, and an initiative tracker.
      Encounter​(java.lang.String[] playerNames, int[] init, int[] monsterID, double[] monsterCR)
      This is a different constructor that takes in the player names and initiatives.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addMonster​(int ind)
      The method will take in a integer that will represent the monster the user wishes to add We will then add that monster into the initiative.
      void addMonsterCR​(double challengeRating)
      The program will find a monster with the same CR as what was given.
      void nextTurn()
      This method will iterate and change the head of the initiative to the next person in line.
      Character removeChar​(int index)
      The program will remove a player/monster from the initiative by taking in an index.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Encounter

        public Encounter​(int numMon,
                 int numP)
        This will build an encounter which will have an array of Monsters, Players, and an initiative tracker. The methods are completely random
        Parameters:
        numMon - will hold how many randomly generated monsters will be included
        numP - will hold how many players in the encounter

      • Encounter

        public Encounter​(java.lang.String[] playerNames,
                 int[] init,
                 int[] monsterID,
                 double[] monsterCR)
        This is a different constructor that takes in the player names and initiatives. This will add players to the initiative tracker with their corresponding initiative values This will also add monsters based on the method the user wishes to do so The monsters can be added via their ID opr via their CR Helper methods will handle this The constructor will then sort the initiatives accordingly
        Parameters:
        playerNames - a list of player names
        init - a list of initiatives
        monsterID - a list of ID's of monsters to add to the rotation
        monsterCR - a list of CR's of monsters to add to the rotation

    • Method Detail

      • nextTurn

        public void nextTurn()
        This method will iterate and change the head of the initiative to the next person in line. This gets messy but we convert from an arraylist to a list, and then back to an arraylist We sort the list and then convert back. This makes it so our previous logic still holds.

      • removeChar

        public Character removeChar​(int index)
        The program will remove a player/monster from the initiative by taking in an index. There is no need resort since it will still be in order
        Parameters:
        index - This program will take in the index of the character we want to remove
        Returns:
        The method will return the chracter removed in case we want to use it at a later point

      • addMonster

        public void addMonster​(int ind)
        The method will take in a integer that will represent the monster the user wishes to add We will then add that monster into the initiative. We do not need to sort initiative
        Parameters:
        ind - is the index of the monster in the constructor for monsters

      • addMonsterCR

        public void addMonsterCR​(double challengeRating)
        The program will find a monster with the same CR as what was given. If no such CR exists within our amount of monsters, it will return a random Monster
        Parameters:
        challengeRating - is the challenge rating of the monster we want to add
